sentence: …clerks, and Senator's prowess,      To the Pages and doorkeepers whose faces beam.      In the Senate no one engages in Churlishness,       Because then they would break Rule XIX.      The Senate has been living for centuries,      Alive by following our framers' themes.                                By Hunter Coy       Sun rises on the Capitol dome…

…he reached  out across the aisle and worked with a particularly vile Democrat, a  guy by the name of Benjamin ``Pitchfork'' Tillman--just a bad, bad guy.  Actually, our rule XIX, which we use against each other occasionally to  try to settle the tone of debate, it is in our rules because of  Benjamin ``Pitchfork'' Tillman.

Anyway, Roosevelt--a Republican--and…
